intro: Isonandra villosa, commonly known as the hairy isonandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Isonandra villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
